FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors package

Submodules

FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.augmentation module

FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.augmentation.CDA(batch: dict, pairs: dict[str, str], columns: list[str] | None = None, bidirectional: bool = True) → dict

function that performs CDA on a batch of training instances

Parameters:

  • batcg (dict) – batch of training instances

  • pairs (dict) – dictionary of counterfactual pairs

  • columns (list[str]) – list of columns on which CDA should be performed. If none, applies CDA to all columns

  • bidirectional (bool) – If true, applies bidirectional CDA (preserves original training instance). If false, deletes original training instance.

Returns:

Augmented training instance modified (dict): Whether or not the training instance was augmented

Return type:

output (dict)

FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.augmentation.CDAPairs_transform(example: dict, pairs: dict[str, str], columns: list[str] | None = None) → tuple[dict, bool]

function that, given an example (dictionary with texts in its various fields) and list of counterfactual pairs, performs CDA on the specified columns

Parameters:

  • example (dict) – training instance

  • pairs (dict) – dictionary of counterfactual pairs

  • columns (list[str]) – list of columns on which CDA should be performed. If none, applies CDA to all columns

Returns:

Augmented training instance modified (dict): Whether or not the training instance was augmented

Return type:

transformed_example (dict)

FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.projection_based module

class FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.projection_based.SentDebiasForSequenceClassification(model: Module | str, config: str | None = None, tokenizer: TokenizerType | None = None, word_pairs: list[tuple] | None = None, n_components: int = 1, device: str | None = None, **kwargs_loss)[source]

Bases: SentDebiasModel

Implementation ready for sequence classification, lacks _get_embedding method

class FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.projection_based.SentDebiasModel(model: Module | str, config: str | None = None, tokenizer: TokenizerType | None = None, word_pairs: list[tuple] | None = None, n_components: int = 1, device: str | None = None, **kwargs_loss)[source]

Bases: Module, ABC

Implements SentDebiasModel, requires the implementation of _get_embedding, _loss and _get_loss methods.

Parameters:

  • model (nn.Module) – language model used

  • config (str) – Optional, configuration to use when using AutoModel

  • tokenizer (TokenizerType) – Tokenizer associated with the model

  • word_pairs (list[tuple[str]]) – list of counterfactual tuples (might be words, sentences,…)

  • n_components (int) – number of components of the bias subspace

  • device (str) – device to run the model on

__init__(model: Module | str, config: str | None = None, tokenizer: TokenizerType | None = None, word_pairs: list[tuple] | None = None, n_components: int = 1, device: str | None = None, **kwargs_loss)[source]

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.reweighting module

class FairLangProc.algorithms.preprocessors.reweighting.BLINDModel(model: Module, config: str | None = None, gamma: float = 2.0, temperature: float = 1.0, hidden_dim: int = 768, **kwargs_loss)[source]

Bases: Module, ABC

Abstract class for implementing BLIND debiasing. Requires implementation of _get_loss and _loss methods

Parameters:

  • model (nn.Module) – Language model to be debiased

  • config (str) – Configuration (optional, only used if using AutoModel)

  • gamma (float) – Hyper-parameter that regulates the strenght of BLIND weights

  • temperature (float) – Hyper-parameter that regulates the softmax of the BLIND logodds

  • hidden_dim (int) – Hyper-parameter, hidden dimension of the language model

__init__(model: Module, config: str | None = None, gamma: float = 2.0, temperature: float = 1.0, hidden_dim: int = 768, **kwargs_loss)[source]

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.
